title.native: 愛少女ポリアンナ物語

description:
Motherless since birth, Pollyanna was an ordinary happy-go-lucky girl, leaving peacefully with her father, the vicar. Then one day her life changes completely when her father dies and she has to live with her aunt whom she has never met before. In the beginning, she seems to be detested by her but as time passes, they develop a very strong bond.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Classic Literature
tags.description: Discusses or adapts a work of classic world literature.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Estranged Family
tags.description: At least one family member of the MC intentionally distances themselves or a family distances themselves from a person related to the MC.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Homeless
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is homeless.

node.description:
__Height:__ 153 cm

Mitsuko Horie is a Japanese seiyuu and singer. She was born in Yamato, Kanagawa, Japan. She is most known to American anime fans as the voice of Sailor Galaxia, but in all Latin-America she is know as the "Candy-Candy" opening theme singer.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%A5%A0%E8%91%89%E5%AE%8F%E4%B8%89)

Kusuba joined Tokyo Movie in 1971. He later moved to Nippon Animation, where he made his directorial debut with [Fuusen no Doratarou](https://anilist.co/anime/5594/) in 1981. In the following years he was one of the main figures behind the studio's World Masterpiece Theater series, a TV anime staple that showcased an animated version of a different classical book or story each year. Kusuba was a freelancer from 2004 up until his death in 2018.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%A5%A0%E8%91%89%E5%AE%8F%E4%B8%89)

Kusuba joined Tokyo Movie in 1971. He later moved to Nippon Animation, where he made his directorial debut with [Fuusen no Doratarou](https://anilist.co/anime/5594/) in 1981. In the following years he was one of the main figures behind the studio's World Masterpiece Theater series, a TV anime staple that showcased an animated version of a different classical book or story each year. Kusuba was a freelancer from 2004 up until his death in 2018.

Yoshifumi Kondou was a Japanese animator who worked for [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/) in his last years, and was most known for directing the film [Whisper of the Heart](https://anilist.co/anime/585/). He was expected to become one of the top directors at Studio Ghibli, alongside [Hayao Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/96870/) and [Isao Takahata](https://anilist.co/staff/100579/), and to become their eventual successor.

Kondou entered Niigata Prefectural Muramatsu High School in April, 1965, where he was a member of the art club. In the school, one of his seniors was the future manga artist [Kimio Yanagisawa](https://anilist.co/staff/100609/). In April, 1968, he moved to Tokyo after graduating from high school, where he entered Tokyo Design College's animation department. In October, 1968, he began working at [Shin-Ei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/247/), then A Production. There he took part in the production of shows like [Kyojin no Hoshi](https://anilist.co/anime/5834/) and [Lupin III](https://anilist.co/anime/1412/). In 1978, Kondou moved to [Nippon Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/22/), where he worked on shows such as [Future Boy Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/302/) and [Anne of Green Gables](https://anilist.co/anime/283/), making his proper character designing debut in the latter.

In December 1980, Kondou moved to [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/), where he served as the character designer for [Sherlock Hound](https://anilist.co/anime/1972/). Kondou resigned from his position at Telecom in March of 1985, and was hospitalized from June through August for a type of pneumonia. He became a contract worker for Nippon Animation afterwards and moved to Studio Ghibli in January, 1987.

In 1995, he made his directorial debut with the renown Studio Ghibli film, Whisper of the Heart.

Kondou suddenly passed away from an aortic dissection on January 21, 1998, which according to doctors had been brought on by overwork. Kondou’s death is also believed to be the reason for Miyazaki’s initial announcement of retirement.

(Source: Wikipedia)

Satou Yoshiharu is animator, animation supervisor and character designer. He was born in Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan.

After graduating from Kanagawa Technical High School he joined Studio Carpenter, before transferring to Nippon Animation, where he worked as a long-time animator on the World Masterpiece Theater series. His next station was Ghibli, where he once again worked as animator on most of the Studio's early works. In 1986 he co-founded Studio 4°C. He rejoined Nippon Animation to resume working on the World Masterpiece Theater series until its termination in 1997. He became a freelancer but eventually joined Taito, where he worked until March 2009. Due to the restart of the World Masterpiece Theater series, he returned to Nippon Animation to work on Konnichiwa Anne.

(Source: AniDB)

Originating from [Nippon Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/22/). Directs on rare occasions.

Worked for Square Enix in Honolulu, Hawaii together with [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/) and others for the first decade of the 2000s and was completely absent from the anime industry because of this. Returned in 2011 and has been active since.

James Lord Pierpont (April 25, 1822 – August 5, 1893) was a New England-born songwriter, arranger, organist, Confederate Soldier, and composer, best known for writing and composing "Jingle Bells" in 1857, originally entitled "The One Horse Open Sleigh". He was born in Boston, Massachusetts, and died in Winter Haven, Florida. His composition "Jingle Bells" has become synonymous with the Christmas holiday and is one of the most performed and most recognizable songs in the world. 

(Source: Wikipedia)

A Japanese poet, lyricist and translator. During his life, he wrote many lyrics for school songs (mainly for school in the Saitama area, in which he wrote more than 300) and nursery rhymes. He is also known for his adaptation of the "One Horse Open Sleigh" (popularly known as "Jingle Bells"), that despite being written at the end of the 50s, after became the part of the original soundtrack for [Ai Shoujo Pollyanna Monogatari](https://anilist.co/anime/2554/Ai-Shoujo-Pollyanna-Monogatari) started appearing regularly in animes, appearing in the likes of Sailor Moon, One Piece and Nogizaka Haruka no Himitsu. And became widely known after a clip of its usage in the PSP game Fate/Extra gone viral with the meme "Padoru, Padoru"

Eleanor H. Porter was an American novelist. 
She is best known as the author of Pollyanna, the children’s novel that took America by storm during the World War I years.

(Source: Wikipedia)
